sentence1: She showed evidence of invincible courage, an endless capacity for work, and a tireless concern for all her many dependents and servitors.
sentence2: While traveling about her estates, Madame Margaret one evening came to the tavern in Fjelkinge.

sentence1: While traveling about her estates, Madame Margaret one evening came to the tavern in Fjelkinge.
sentence2: She was quartered for the night in a room that had the name of being haunted.

sentence1: She was quartered for the night in a room that had the name of being haunted.
sentence2: Some years before a traveler had lain in the same room and presumably had been murdered.

sentence1: Some years before a traveler had lain in the same room and presumably had been murdered.
sentence2: At any rate, the man himself and all his belongings had disappeared without leaving a trace.

sentence1: At any rate, the man himself and all his belongings had disappeared without leaving a trace.
sentence2: She had already shown greater courage in greater contingencies, and chose this particular room to sleep in without any fear.

sentence1: She had already shown greater courage in greater contingencies, and chose this particular room to sleep in without any fear.
sentence2: She let the lamp burn and fell asleep, after she had said her evening prayer.

sentence1: She let the lamp burn and fell asleep, after she had said her evening prayer.
sentence2: On the stroke of twelve she awoke, just as some planks were raised in the floor.

sentence1: On the stroke of twelve she awoke, just as some planks were raised in the floor.
sentence2: Up rose a bleeding phantom whose head, split wide open, hung down on his shoulder.

sentence1: Up rose a bleeding phantom whose head, split wide open, hung down on his shoulder.
sentence2: "Noble lady," whispered the specter, "prepare a grave in consecrated earth for a murdered man.

sentence1: "Noble lady," whispered the specter, "prepare a grave in consecrated earth for a murdered man.
sentence2: Deliver his murderer to the judgment which is his due!"

sentence1: Deliver his murderer to the judgment which is his due!"
sentence2: God-fearing and unafraid, Madame Margaret beckoned the phantom nearer.

sentence1: God-fearing and unafraid, Madame Margaret beckoned the phantom nearer.
sentence2: He told her he had already addressed the same prayer to various other people.

sentence1: He told her he had already addressed the same prayer to various other people.
sentence2: But none had had the courage to grant it.

sentence1: But none had had the courage to grant it.
sentence2: Then Madame Margaret drew a gold ring from her finger, laid it on the gaping wound, and tied up the head of the murdered man with her kerchief.

sentence1: Then Madame Margaret drew a gold ring from her finger, laid it on the gaping wound, and tied up the head of the murdered man with her kerchief.
sentence2: With a glance of unspeakable gratitude he told her the murderer's name, and disappeared beneath the floor without a sound.

sentence1: With a glance of unspeakable gratitude he told her the murderer's name, and disappeared beneath the floor without a sound.
sentence2: The following morning Madame Margaret sent for the sheriff of the district to come to the tavern with some of his people.

sentence1: The following morning Madame Margaret sent for the sheriff of the district to come to the tavern with some of his people.
sentence2: She informed him of what had happened to her during the night, and ordered those present to tear up the floor.

sentence1: She informed him of what had happened to her during the night, and ordered those present to tear up the floor.
sentence2: And there they found, buried in the earth, the remains of a body and, in a wound in its head, the Countess's ring.

sentence1: And there they found, buried in the earth, the remains of a body and, in a wound in its head, the Countess's ring.
sentence2: One of the bystanders grew pale at the sight, and fell senseless to the ground.

sentence1: One of the bystanders grew pale at the sight, and fell senseless to the ground.
sentence2: When he came to his senses, he confessed that he had murdered the traveler and robbed him of his belongings.

sentence1: When he came to his senses, he confessed that he had murdered the traveler and robbed him of his belongings.
sentence2: He was condemned to death for his crime, and the body of the murdered man was buried in the village church-yard.

sentence1: He was condemned to death for his crime, and the body of the murdered man was buried in the village church-yard.
sentence2: And when one of the Barnekows dies, it is said that a red spot, like a drop of blood, appears on the stone.
